panels.content:
# Available measurements ("tables" with metric info) overview

### NB! Metrics that are actually gathered need to be configured for every DB separately - for that open the Web UI config page [here](http://0.0.0.0:8080/dbs)  or modify the "pgwatch2.monitored_host" table directly in the "pgwatch2" database

* backends - active, total, waiting sessions
* bgwriter - pg_stat_bgwriter snapshots
* cpu_load - CPU load info acquired via a plpython sproc (/pgwatch2/sql/metric_fetching_helpers/)
* db_stats - pg_stat_database snapshots + DB size info
* index_stats - pg_stat_user_indexes snapshots
* kpi - most important high level metrics
* replication - pg_stat_replication info
* sproc_stats - pg_stat_user_functions snapshots
* table_io_stats - pg_statio_user_tables snapshots
* stat_statements - pg_stat_statements snapshots (requires the extension) 
* table_stats - pg_stat_user_tables snapshots
* wal - pg_current_xlog_location() values

# For getting started with Grafana in general start [here](http://docs.grafana.org/guides/getting_started/)



# For learning InfluxDB query language InfluxQL start [here](https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/v1.2/query_language/)

# When stuck then additional support and consultations are available from Cybertec - http://www.cybertec.at/kontakt/
